title: User can see a player's Roster Status in the Adv Search results properly
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Advanced Search widget
custom_steps: WHEN a user runs an advanced search for a "Professional Player"
custom_expected:
THEN the Roster Status column should display the MJ or MN roster status as it would appear on their player profile.
AND this includes showing "Optioned/MN Roster Status" for optioned players.

title: BOC user can edit an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a new manual entry that has been saved to the player history
AND a pencil icon appears in view mode for ONLY the rows that have been manually added
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the pencil icon places the entire row in edit mode, and enables a save button.
custom_expected:
THEN user has the ability to edit all values of the manual entry
AND Save must be clicked to maintain any changes to the row

title: BOC user can cancel all changes to edits in a player's history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND one or more row is in edit mode
AND Cancel All Changes button appears to the right of the Save button
custom_steps: WHEN the cancel button is clicked
custom_expected: The widget is refreshed into view mode and none of the edits are reflected.

title: BOC user can delete an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user 
AND there is an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
AND a trash can icon appears on any row that has been manually added to the Player History.
AND the icon appears for both entries that have been previously saved and newly added entries that have not yet been saved.
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking the trash can on entries that were previously saved will prompt the user to confirm the deletion of the row.
custom_expected:
THEN If they confirm, the row is permanently deleted 
AND a blue notification is thrown confirming the deletion
BUT If they do not confirm then the row is maintained. 
AND Clicking the trash can on entries that have not been previously saved will just remove the row.
AND If the row that is being removed was the only row in edit mode, then the entire widget is returned to view mode.

title: User can filter the Player History
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user in on a Player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking the filter icon
custom_expected:
THEN filter pop-out will be displayed
AND the available filters will be:
- Contracts
     - Major Transactions
     - Minor Transactions
     - Misc
     - Employees (to be added later)
AND Contracts filter will have "All" selected by default. 
BUT Deselecting All will enable the multi-select dropdown with the options Major, Minor and Employee. 
AND Selecting "Minor" will include all Minor Contract associated items (including all addenda)
AND Major and Minor Transactions filters will have "All" selected by default.
BUT  Deselecting All will enable the multi-select dropdown with a list of the Major or Minor Transactions in the system available as options. 
AND The two exceptions are that all Disabled List and Rehab transactions should be lumped under the option "All D/L"
AND any inactive list transaction should be lumped under "Inactive Lists" as an option. 
AND Applying the filters will filter the player history to the user's selections.

title: Pro Player Profile - Permissions- Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The professional player profile has a view permission set (Basic) that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users without the permission cannot view professional players anywhere in the system.
AND This includes being able to conduct an Advanced Search or a Quick Search for professional players. 
AND The professional player profile also has an edit permission (Admin) set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users without the permission cannot edit the professional player profile.
custom_expected:
THEN 

ADMINS:
Can search for, view and edit all Professional Player Profiles.
Can only edit players that belong to their Org. 
Can only see the contact info and National ID section of players that belong to their Org. 

BASIC:
Can search for and view all Processional Player Profiles.
Can only see the contact info and National ID section of players that belong to their Org.

title: Pro Player Profile - Permissions- BOC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The professional player profile has a view permission set (Basic) that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users without the permission cannot view professional players anywhere in the system.
AND This includes being able to conduct an Advanced Search or a Quick Search for professional players. 
AND The professional player profile also has an edit permission (Admin) set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users without the permission cannot edit the professional player profile.
custom_expected:
THEN

ADMINS:
Can search for, view and edit all Professional Player Profiles [Club and BOC].
Can view all sections at all times.

BASIC:
Can search for and view all Processional Player Profiles [Club and BOC].

AND In the Career view the player will have one line per team that they acquired stats for per year
AND Stats will be sorted in reverse chronological order
AND Totals displayed will only display for levels that the player has stats for

title: Filter the Stats tab to include Major, Minor or Off-Season stats

custom_steps:
WHEN Checking Major, Minor or Off-Season check box
AND UnChecking Major, Minor or Off-Season check box
custom_expected:
THEN it will load any Major, Minor, or Off-Season stats the player has for the selected filters, including any totals
AND it will hide any of the Major, Minor, or Off-Season Stats the player has for the selected filters, including any totals.  
AND if no stats remain to be displayed with the current selection of filters "NO STATS FOUND" will display.

title: User can view a player's day by day stats on their Professional Player Profile Stats Tab
custom_preconds: GIVEN "Career" and "Game Logs" will be options in the first filter dropdown on the Stats page
custom_steps: WHEN selecting  "Game Logs"
custom_expected:
THEN the page should refresh to show the day by day stats for the player for the current year
AND Year" filter is automatically displayed whenever "Game Logs" is selected, and defaults to the current year. 
AND Changing the Year filter to a previous year will refresh the page to load a previous year's day by day stats. 
AND Future years should not be available in the dropdown. 
AND Year dropdown should go back as far as the player has stats
BUT should not display years prior to the player's first MLB stat. 
AND Major, Minor and Off-Season checkbox filters should remain on the page and still function. 
AND Selecting or deselecting "Major" "Minor" or "Off-Season" should respectively show or hide the games associated with that level of play. 
AND Stats will be sorted in reverse chronological order. 
AND Totals displayed will only display for levels that the player has stats for.

title: A Club user can load an existing Passed Over player profile to sign him
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a Club user
custom_steps: WHEN opening and viewing any Passed Over player profile
custom_expected:
THEN  The system should load the latest draft record for the player UNLESS the player has been entered into the current draft by another Club
AND If the viewing Club has a profile for the player, load that profile.
AND If the viewing Club does not have a profile for the player, load the BOC profile. 
AND If the viewing Club does not have a profile for the player and there is no BOC Copy, load the first entry for the player from the most recent draft (that the Club has permission to view). 
AND Club users should only see Contact Info entered by their own Org.
AND if they do not have a record for this player then this section will display as blank

title: Updates to Domestic Amateur Quick Search
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a CLUB user
custom_steps: WHEN in the Quick Search
custom_expected:
THEN Clubs should start to see Passed Over players, even from other Clubs in the Quick Search population
AND the population of players should go back 5 draft years
AND  include all future draft years as well. 
AND each player should only appear in quick search once. 
BUT Club users do not see "Multiple" or other Club origins
AND if they entered the player and he was not also entered by the MLSB or was a Re-Draft, he will show their Org's abbreviation. 
AND if he was entered by more than one other club and not the viewing Club, then his origin will read "Club"
AND Clubs should continue to NOT see other Clubs' current year players in quick search.

title: A user can view the player's Drafted record up until the Signing Deadline, unless the player is marked as Not Subject to Deadline
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a player is not marked Not Subject to Deadline
AND the current date is past the Signing Deadline date
custom_steps: WHEN there is any Drafted player profile in the system.
custom_expected:
THEN user will be able to open and view it
AND when the profile loads, if the player was drafted in the most recent draft
AND the current date is before the Signing Deadline
THEN always load the previous year's draft record
AND NOT the current year's pending eligible record. 
BUT if the player was drafted in the most recent draft and the current date is after the Signing Deadline
AND if the record is marked Not Subject to Deadline
THEN continue to load the previous year's draft record.

title: A Club user can edit an existing Passed Over player profile so club can sign him

GIVEN a user is a Club user
AND viewing a Passed Over player profile
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the "Edit Signing Info" button
custom_expected:

AND the user will have the ability to edit all of the non-matching fields for the player (Not First, Last, DOB or School). 
AND clicking "Save" will save the changes to the profile and store the new Club record for the player where relevant. 
AND no change is made to any eligibility or draft history information.

AND the user will have the ability to edit all of the non-matching fields for the player (Not First, Last, DOB or School). 
AND clicking "Save" will save the changes to the profile. No change is made to any eligibility information.

title: A user can cancel changes to a domestic amateur player profile

custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Cancel"
custom_expected:

AND if the profile was not previously saved, confirming the cancel will take the user back to the point of entry

title: A BOC user can edit a Passed Over player profile on behalf of a Club so that they can sign him
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AN can open and view any Passed Over player profile in the system
custom_steps:
WHEN a BOC user is viewing a Passed Over player profile, they should see an "Edit Signing Info" button, and no Edit button
AND clicking the "Edit Signing Info" button
custom_expected:
THEN it will prompt the BOC user to select which Org they are editing the record on behalf of
AND Once they have selected the Org, the system should reload the profile in edit mode.
AND If the player was an MLSB or Redraft player, then load that record in edit mode. 
AND If the Org selected already had a profile entered for the most recent draft the player participated in, then load that record in edit mode
BUT otherwise load the BOC Copy if it exists. 
AND load the first profile entered for the player for the most recent draft the player participated in.  
AND on the backend, if a record did not yet exist for this Club for the last year that the player had his profile entered in the draft, one is created for him. 
AND the user will have the ability to edit all of the fields for the player. 
AND clicking "Save" will save the changes to the profile and store the new Club record for the player where relevant.

title: BOC user can edit Int'l Amateur player profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user views an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN International Amateur Profile should have an Edit button and a Close button in View mode
AND BOC users should be able to edit all sections of the profile
AND clicking edit should reload the profile in edit mode
AND Contact Information section should be displayed as separate sections for Phone Numbers, Emails, and Addresses
AND By default, at least one address fieldset, one phone number fieldset, and one email fieldset should display
AND users should be able to add additional address, phone, and email fieldsets by clicking the Add button found in each section
AND Users should be able to remove additional fieldsets by clicking on the trashcan icon
AND trashcan icon should only display in edit mode
AND if only one fieldset in a section displays, then the trashcan icon should NOT display
AND users should have the ability to select the country associated with the address
AND country selected should drive what additional fields display, and whether they are Select2 or Text inputs
AND details for this should be the same as was previously used for agent and agency profiles
AND zip Code should only be displayed for the United States, Canada and US territories (Puerto Rico, Guam, US Virgin Islands)
AND Formatting checks should only be done if the country selected is the United States (In that case, the system will need to verify that 5 numbers have been entered for the Zip Code field)
AND while in edit mode, a Save button should be available

AND Bio Info and National ID sections should NOT be editable
AND Clicking edit should reload the profile in edit mode
AND Contact Information section should be displayed as separate sections for Phone Numbers, Emails, and Addresses
AND By default, at least one address fieldset, one phone number fieldset, and one email fieldset should display
AND Users should be able to add additional address, phone, and email fieldsets by clicking the Add button found in each section
AND Users should be able to remove additional fieldsets by clicking on the trashcan icon
AND trashcan icon should only display in edit mode
AND if only one fieldset in a section displays, then the trashcan icon should NOT display
AND users should have the ability to select the country associated with the address
AND the country selected should drive what additional fields display, and whether they are Select2 or Text inputs
AND details for this should be the same as was previously used for agent and agency profiles
AND Zip Code should only be displayed for the United States, Canada and US territories (Puerto Rico, Guam, US Virgin Islands)
AND formatting checks should only be done if the country selected is the United States (In that case, the system will need to verify that 5 numbers have been entered for the Zip Code field)
AND while in edit mode, a Save button should be available

title: User can Cancel changes to an Int'l Amateur player profile

custom_steps: WHEN user views an International Amateur Profile in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN Save and Cancel buttons should be present
AND when Save is clicked, a required fields check should be run
AND if any required fields are not complete, the standard error message should display
AND National ID formatting rules must be followed
AND formatting checks should only be done if the country selected is the United States (In that case, the system will need to verify that 5 numbers have been entered for the Zip Code field)
AND once required fields check has passed, changes should be committed and profile should load in view mode
AND when Cancel is clicked, user should see confirmation message if they wish to cancel
AND if they confirm the cancellation, any changes the users made while in edit mode should not be committed, and profile should load in view mode
AND if users do not confirm the cancellation, user should be returned to profile in edit mode

title: Required fields check on int't amateur reg. profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is editing an international amateur player profile
custom_steps:
WHEN required fields are missing
AND user clicks Save
custom_expected:
THEN user receives an error

**extended last name and middle name are not required, but the user should be able to check the N/A boxes next to them and the fields should hide, even if text was previously entered into them.

**Required fields are as followed and should contain a red asterisk:
Bio Information 
- Roster First Name is required
- Twin Count is required. Possible values for Twin Count are 0-8. 
- Birth Country, Birth State, Birth City are required
(Note: Clubs are not able to edit Bio information)

Scouting Information
- Position(s) is required 
- Language is required  

Contact Information
- Phone number(s) fields are required HOWEVER clubs will see a warning if left blank and BOC will see no message whatsoever.
- Email Address(es) fields are NOT required 
- Address(s) fields are required 
     - Zip Code is only displayed for the United States, Canada and US territories (Puerto Rico, Guam, US Virgin Islands)
     - Formatting checks will only be done if the country selected is the United States. In that case, the system will need to verify that 5 numbers have been entered for the Zip Code field.
